body.p:
Your esteemed favor of 18' of last month is
before me, in reply to which I would like to treat of business first
& of miscellanious things afterwards. We are owing you incl. The
now ending vol. of the Occident $11.00, of which we have to deduct an
outlay for postage on the 23' March 1848 for books send to S. Coh. Here
$—73 remaining $10.72, for which please to find an order to N. Y.
enclosed, acknowledging its receipt in the next Occident.

Your bill against S. Coh we have presented,
to which he replied as follows: I have remitted Mr Leeser on the
23' Jan 1848 by you (respect. Kohn, the same having been send in the letter
ordering the Occident) Three Dollars, then again I have receipt for
Three Dollars in the Occident of June 1849, & Six Dollars were send
by me to Mr Leeser some time in Febr. Last, which makes up the 12
Dollars, the amount of the bill. I hope it is in order, please
to write about it.

In regard to your retiring from your office
last fall, I felt sorry when reading of it, there must have been
a serious misunderstanding between you & your congr. to have caused
such a step, as far as I could learn, you acted the part of a
man of self respect by retiring. I regret very much, that I
could not do much with your circulars, to procure you new subscribers
there is too much indifferism amongst Hebrew about their holy Religion
its defenders, or any thing out of trade, it is realy deplorable, but
let us hope for better in the future. I have always looked
upon the Occid. as a welcome visitor, I like its tendency & spirit
& shall always peruse any of the volumes with pleasure & satisfaction.

But Mr Leeser I would advice you one thing
that if you do wish more subscribers for your Occ. or weekly
paper about to be published, do come out on a Editors Tour
to the west, & by personally soliciting subscribers to your Periodicals

you will get 10 subscribers, to one you might get without
it. If you start after Hebrew & go to New York Albany Utica
Syracuse Rochester Bufalo Erie Cleveland Sandusky Toledo Detroit
Milwaukee Chicago Peru Pevria? St Louis, & then down the Miss.
& Ohio up towards Cincinatti & home again, I will warrant you
a great many new names on your Lists, & they pay all, which
is a principal thing. From Albany West you will find
Hebrew in every town or City of little importance, who will take
your Occ. if they see you & the paper. There area great many
who never heard of it, do come out & show it to them, tell them
that it is a necessary Book in their families, particularly for
those who live isolated in places where there are only a few
& no Hebrew or Synagogue. Please look on the maps and
note every little town from here down the Illinois River to St Louis
& from there on the Miss. & then to Cincinnati & you will find
Hebrew in every town of importance, who will take your paper
if you present it yourself. The Exp. of travelling will come out
of it. This is a friendly advice of mine, you may take it
into consideration, it is given gratis, & with the best intentions.

They are at present forming a Congreg. at Detroit
Mich, another has been started at Milwaukee, where there
are a great many families congregated from Bohemia.

Here we began a Hebrew 3 years ago with 15 members
we now number 40 paying members, have a Burial Ground, & by
building a Synagogue now, we are under an Expense of ca
2200 Dollars to come out of the pockets of the members. There
are a good many things besides building a Synagogue to be wished
but patience & perseverance will accomplish a great many things.

By and bye, the Asmonean lately had an article
from a Corresp. from here, in which it states that by the liberality
of the NY. merchant we are enabled to go on with our work
of building, this is not a fact, all we got from NY. Was
from 60 to 65 Dollars, honor to whom honor is due!

Another thing! Could you not publish those several
= Dias letters = in Phamplet form? they would sell well
every traveling Hebrew in the M. S. wuld buy one I warrant you.

If you would try to give in your next volume of
the Occident some more light reading for children, some
extracts from Hebrew, little anecdotes, little parables cc suitable
for the young, it would be some improvement, & lead to more
subscribers. There are a great many who do not like always
grave matters or articles requiring thought & study, some lighter
food will sometimes be more acceptable.

Your Editions of Hebrew cc you will
also have oportunity to sell, if you should resolve to make a
Western Tour.

About those Hebrew you send by Mr Goldsmith NY
I never got them, neither are they with any of the booksellers
here. Finally Mr Leeser, I shall be in NY. on or about
Hebrew, & should be very happy to make your personal acquaintance
should you come there, you will easily find me by inquiring
after me. Please to excuse my long epistle, any faults
in the writing of it, I am only a German decendant of Hebrew.
